body_html:
I met the same error.
I looked into configure.py and found the code below

cuda_toolkit_paths_full = [os.path.join(cuda_toolkit_path, x) for x in cuda_rt_lib_paths]
......(4 lines here)
print('Invalid path to CUDA %s toolkit. %s cannot be found' %
      (tf_cuda_version, cuda_toolkit_path_full))

The print is where the error happened, so I think it's just a misspelling…
The script wants to tell you that your path to CUDA is invalid, so maybe check again the location you tell the script where CUDA is installed.

body:
I met the same error.
I looked into `configure.py` and found the code below
```python
cuda_toolkit_paths_full = [os.path.join(cuda_toolkit_path, x) for x in cuda_rt_lib_paths]
......(4 lines here)
print('Invalid path to CUDA %s toolkit. %s cannot be found' %
      (tf_cuda_version, cuda_toolkit_path_full))
```
The `print` is where the error happened, so I think it's just a misspelling…
The script wants to tell you that your path to CUDA is invalid, so maybe check again the location you tell the script where CUDA is installed.
